revised_title: A Monstrous Horned Sheep: A Rare Case Study
tldr: This article describes a sheep with a monstrous horn growing from its throat, which was presented to the Royal Society in 1754. The sheep's horn was so large that it required great strength to move and hold it up, yet the animal was able to adapt to its unusual condition. The stuffed skin of the sheep, with the horn still attached, is now on display in the museum of the Royal Society.
